it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.arp

Class ArpPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.arp.ArpPacket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Packet, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ArpPacket
extends java.lang.Object
implements Packet
    Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packet.

    • Field Detail

      • ARP_REQUEST

        public static final int ARP_REQUEST
        Request operation
        See Also:

      • ARP_REPLY

        public static final int ARP_REPLY
        Reply operation

        Constant Field Values

      • HARDWARE_TYPE_ETH

        public static final int HARDWARE_TYPE_ETH
        Hardware type Ethernet
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROTOCOL_TYPE_IP4

        public static final int PROTOCOL_TYPE_IP4
        Protocol type IPv4
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • src_addr

        protected Address src_addr
        Source address

      • dst_addr

        protected Address dst_addr
        Destination address

      • htype

        protected int htype
        Hardware type (HTYPE). This field specifies the network protocol type. Example: Ethernet is 1

      • ptype

        protected int ptype
        Protocol type (PTYPE). This field specifies the internetworking protocol for which the ARP request is intended. For IPv4, this has the value 0x0800. The permitted PTYPE values share a numbering space with those for EtherType

      • hlen

        protected int hlen
        Hardware length (HLEN). Length (in octets) of a hardware address. Ethernet addresses size is 6

      • plen

        protected int plen
        Protocol length (PLEN). Length (in octets) of addresses used in the upper layer protocol. (The upper layer protocol specified in PTYPE.) IPv4 address size is 4

      • operation

        protected int operation
        Operation. Specifies the operation that the sender is performing: 1 for request, 2 for reply

      • sha

        protected byte[] sha
        Sender hardware address (SHA). Media address of the sender

      • spa

        protected byte[] spa
        Sender protocol address (SPA). Internetwork address of the sender

      • tha

        protected byte[] tha
        Target hardware address (THA). Media address of the intended receiver. In an ARP request this field is ignored. In an ARP reply this field is used to indicate the address of the host that originated the ARP request

      • tpa

        protected byte[] tpa
        Target protocol address (TPA). Internetwork address of the intended receiver

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArpPacket

        public ArpPacket(Address src_addr,
                 Address dst_addr,
                 int htype,
                 int ptype,
                 int hlen,
                 int plen,
                 int operation,
                 byte[] sha,
                 byte[] spa,
                 byte[] tha,
                 byte[] tpa)
        Creates a new ARP packet.
        Parameters:
        src_addr - source address (null if unknown)
        src_addr - source address
        htype - data-link hardware protocol type. Example: Ethernet is 1
        ptype - network protocol for which the ARP request is intended. For IPv4, this has the value 0x0800
        hlen - length (in octets) of a hardware address. Ethernet addresses size is 6
        plen - length (in octets) of addresses used in the upper layer protocol. (The upper layer protocol specified in PTYPE.) IPv4 address size is 4
        operation - operation that the sender is performing: 1 for request, 2 for reply
        sha - sender data-link hardware address
        spa - sender network protocol address
        tha - target data-link hardware address
        tpa - target network protocol address

      • ArpPacket

        public ArpPacket(Address src_addr,
                 Address dst_addr,
                 int operation,
                 EthAddress shaddr,
                 Ip4Address spaddr,
                 EthAddress thaddr,
                 Ip4Address tpaddr)
        Creates a new ARP packet.
        Parameters:
        src_addr - source address (null if unknown)
        src_addr - source address
        operation - operation that the sender is performing: 1 for request, 2 for reply
        shaddr - sender data-link hardware address
        spaddr - sender network protocol address
        thaddr - target data-link hardware address
        tpaddr - target network protocol address
